Hi everyone: Hate being the new guy but I think I messed something up
I keep seeing stuff online about swap but when I set my system up, i didn't set up swap
Is it too late to add swap after I've already installed Ubuntu?
Ubuntu creates a swap partition by default. Did you use automatic partitioning in the installer or manual?
How can I see my partitions?  fdisk?
I would recommend using GParted from a LiveCD/USB. After you create a swap partition you will need to add an entry for it in your /etc/fstab.

I would expect that you'd need to be in the session you're trying to repair. And the command is expected to "hang" as unity will continue running.
